Doc: Send email when an output is received. Alternatively, you may include or exclude the email output execution using conditionals.
DocShort: Sends email to a specified address when output is received
Name: email

Options.Doc: The address used to connect to the mail server
Options.Name: Host

Options.Doc: Port used to communicate with the mail server
Options.Name: Port

Options.Doc: Username to authenticate with the server
Options.Name: Username

Options.Doc: Password to authenticate with the server
Options.Name: Password

Options.Doc: The fully-qualified email address for the From: field in the email
Options.Name: From

Options.Doc: The fully qualified email address for the Reply-To: field
Options.Name: Replyto

Options.Doc:
The fully-qualified email address to send the email to.

This field also accepts a comma-separated string of addresses, for example: `"me@host.com, you@host.com"`

You can also use dynamic fields from the event with the %{fieldname} syntax
Options.Name: To

Options.Doc:
The fully-qualified email address(es) to include as cc: address(es).

This field also accepts a comma-separated string of addresses, for example: `"me@host.com, you@host.com"`
Options.Name: Cc

Options.Doc:
The fully-qualified email address(es) to include as bcc: address(es).

This field also accepts a comma-separated string of addresses, for example: `"me@host.com, you@host.com"`
Options.Name: Bcc

Options.Doc:
Subject: for the email

You can use template
Options.Name: Subject

Options.Doc: Path to Subject template file for the email
Options.Name: Subjectfile

Options.Doc: HTML Body for the email, which may contain HTML markup
Options.Name: Htmlbody

Options.Doc:
Local path to HTML Body template file for the email, which may contain HTML markup
can be relative to the configuration file
TODO : use a Location Type like sql processor
Options.Name: Htmlbodyfile

Options.Doc: Body for the email - plain text only.
Options.Name: Body

Options.Doc: Path to Body template file for the email.
Options.Name: Bodyfile

Options.Doc: Attachments - specify the name(s) and location(s) of the files
Options.Name: Attachments
